com.flir.flironesdk

Class Device

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flir.flironesdk.Device
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class Device
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
    Represents a connected FLIR ONE device, including the methods for interacting and capturing images and videos from it.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Device.BatteryChargingState
      Represents the state of the battery, if present
      static interface  Device.Delegate
      Defines callback methods for device state updates
      static interface  Device.PowerUpdateDelegate
      Power-specific callback methods
      static interface  Device.StreamDelegate
      Defines callback method for handling stream capture events
      static class  Device.TuningState
      Represents the state of the flat-field calibration tuning

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Device(Device.Delegate delegate)
      Constructs a simulated device that can stream a frame loop provided in a zip file with connectSimulatedDevice.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Call this method when the USB device disconnects, is no longer needed, or if the application is paused.
      void connectSimulatedDevice(java.io.InputStream sampleFramesZipData)
      Connects a simulated device.
      void performTuning()
      Call this method if tuning is required or requested for high thermal accuracy
      void setAutomaticTuning(boolean shouldAutomaticallyTune)
      Disable or enable the automatic tuning feature of the device.
      void setPowerUpdateDelegate(Device.PowerUpdateDelegate powerUpdateDelegate)
      If the device has a battery, power status updates will be sent to the power update delegate
      static void startDiscovery(Context context, Device.Delegate delegate)
      Call this method to connect to a FLIR One device, typically you should call this from your activity's onResume method, passing your app context and device delegate.
      void startFrameStream(Device.StreamDelegate delegate)
      Call this method after onDeviceConnected has been called on the device delegate to start frame streaming.
      static void stopDiscovery()
      Call this method during onPause to stop listening for devices connected over USB This prevents the current app from capturing connection events in the background, when other apps may need to receive them
      void stopFrameStream()
      Call this method to stop frame streaming This method will have no effect if called if frames are not streaming

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Device

        public Device(Device.Delegate delegate)
        Constructs a simulated device that can stream a frame loop provided in a zip file with connectSimulatedDevice.

    • Method Detail

      • startFrameStream

        public void startFrameStream(Device.StreamDelegate delegate)
        Call this method after onDeviceConnected has been called on the device delegate to start frame streaming. This method will have no effect if called before the device is ready

      • stopFrameStream

        public void stopFrameStream()
        Call this method to stop frame streaming This method will have no effect if called if frames are not streaming

      • startDiscovery

        public static void startDiscovery(Context context,
                                  Device.Delegate delegate)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Call this method to connect to a FLIR One device, typically you should call this from your activity's onResume method, passing your app context and device delegate. This will start a broadcast receiver listening for connected devices. It will call the delegate's deviceDiscovered method when one is created this way
        Parameters:
        context - The application context, used for registering broadcast receiver
        delegate - The delegate for discovered devices to be created with
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When called multiple times in succession without calling stopDiscovery

      • stopDiscovery

        public static void stopDiscovery()
        Call this method during onPause to stop listening for devices connected over USB This prevents the current app from capturing connection events in the background, when other apps may need to receive them

      • connectSimulatedDevice

        public void connectSimulatedDevice(java.io.InputStream sampleFramesZipData)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Connects a simulated device. This
        Parameters:
        sampleFramesZipData - should be an InputStream to a zip file of raw thermal and visible frame pairs, with file names of the format lep-00001 for thermal and vis-00001 for the visible. The SDK example application has a raw resource at R.raw.sampleframes
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • setPowerUpdateDelegate

        public void setPowerUpdateDelegate(Device.PowerUpdateDelegate powerUpdateDelegate)
        If the device has a battery, power status updates will be sent to the power update delegate
        Parameters:
        powerUpdateDelegate - The object to receive power updates

      • performTuning

        public void performTuning()
        Call this method if tuning is required or requested for high thermal accuracy
        See Also:
        Device.TuningState

      • setAutomaticTuning

        public void setAutomaticTuning(boolean shouldAutomaticallyTune)
        Disable or enable the automatic tuning feature of the device. The device defaults to automatic tuning being enabled.
        Parameters:
        shouldAutomaticallyTune - Set to false to keep the automatic tuning function from being performed. Set to true to re-enable.

      • close

        public void close()
        Call this method when the USB device disconnects, is no longer needed, or if the application is paused.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
